headline: Customer Success Manager | Ex-KPMG | Driving 110%+ NRR & ROI | Specialized in Scaling Retention Systems & Plugging Revenue Leaks for SaaS & Remote Teams
jobTitle: Customer Success & Engagement Associate (SaaS / Energy Tech)
about:
Most SaaS companies lose more revenue through the back door than they bring in the front. Having audited $500M in assets and managed complex energy-tech implementations, I’ve found that growth is a retention and operations challenge. I specialize in identifying revenue leaks where messy handovers and slow product adoption stall company momentum.

I audit the entire customer lifecycle. By asking the right questions where is the friction in onboarding? Why is the time-to-value lagging? I uncover the blockers to Net Revenue Retention (NRR). Whether at KPMG or ReviveBattery B.V., I lead with a discovery-first mindset to ensure every move is backed by data and aligned with the customer’s business goals.

My response to churn is a bias for action. I build the frameworks that turn new sign-ups into long-term advocates. My track record includes:

Driving Adoption: Increased monthly engagement by 20%+ through structured onboarding workflows.

Operational Excellence: Designed SOPs and Sales-to-Success handovers that eliminate friction and ensure total visibility.

CRM Mastery: Optimizing HubSpot and Salesforce to ensure data accuracy and pipeline health.

Global Impact: Leading enterprise success for remote-first teams across the US, UK, and Australian markets.

 I translate activities into clear business outcomes. Through data-driven QBRs and ROI tracking, I articulate the value of the platform to stakeholders from founders to the C-suite. My goal is simple: to build the structure that drives 90%+ renewals and transforms Customer Success into a predictable revenue engine.

experiences.title: Customer Success & Engagement Associate (SaaS / Energy Tech)
experiences.jobDescription:
Direct enterprise customer success operations and onboarding workflows to drive adoption, retention, and operational efficiency across European markets.

↠ Lifecycle & Operations Management:

Onboarding & Time-to-Value: Managing the post-sale journey to ensure rapid platform integration and measurable customer ROI.

Cross-Functional Coordination: Acting as the primary lead between Sales, Technical, and Marketing teams to execute clean account handovers.

Customer Enablement: Building technical guides, SOPs, and resource libraries to support independent platform usage and scale success.

Client Results & Impact:

Engagement Growth: Restructured onboarding programs that increased monthly engagement by 20% through targeted usage workflows.

Retention Management: Built structured engagement playbooks to proactively identify churn risks and protect Net Revenue Retention (NRR).

Data Accuracy: Maintained 100% CRM precision across renewals and customer touchpoints to provide leadership with clear lifecycle visibility.

Lifecycle Strategy: Delivered data-backed insights to inform retention targets and resolve friction points in the customer journey.

experiences.title: Customer Success & Community Engagement Coordinator
experiences.jobDescription:
Managed end-to-end customer success and community operations, building scalable engagement workflows and retention strategies to drive long-term partner satisfaction and participation.

↠ Signature Engagement & Lifecycle Workflows:

Onboarding & Lifecycle Communication: Directed the post-sign-up journey, ensuring new members reached active participation through structured messaging.

Community Program Coordination: Designed and led peer-to-peer programs to increase satisfaction and membership value.

Process Standardization: Created repeatable SOPs and engagement templates that allowed the organization to scale without increasing manual workload.

Client Results & Impact:

Lowered Drop-off Rates: Analyzed engagement data to find friction points, implementing program changes that improved completion and retention.

Operational Efficiency: Standardized the "Success-to-Community" handover, turning manual tasks into automated, repeatable systems.

Growth Alignment: Collaborated with leadership to ensure all success initiatives directly supported the organization’s expansion and revenue goals.

Resource Development: Built a library of guides and resources that supported independent user success and reduced direct support inquiries.

experiences.title: Customer Success & Social Media Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
Directed onboarding, engagement, and growth operations for a mentorship platform, building the frameworks that helped job seekers and mentors reach measurable success milestones.

↠ Signature Onboarding & Engagement Frameworks:

The 30-Day Success Roadmap: Designed and executed a structured engagement framework to ensure mentors and mentees hit key milestones within their first month.

Knowledge Base Architecture: Built and managed a centralized resource hub to support independent user success and reduce repetitive support inquiries.

Lifecycle Communication: Implemented automated follow-up sequences to drive consistent platform usage and prevent user drop-off.

Client Results & Impact:

20% Engagement Lift: Increased monthly active participation by over 20% through the rollout of data-driven lifecycle follow-ups.

Operational Scalability: Developed repeatable onboarding workflows that allowed the platform to support a higher volume of users without losing service quality.

Growth Operations: Leveraged CRM data and engagement insights to identify and support new growth initiatives alongside leadership.

User Retention: Improved long-term retention by standardizing the mentor-mentee matching process and success tracking.

experiences.title: Onboarding Specialist & Executive Assistant
experiences.jobDescription:
Managed operations, client onboarding, and process optimization to drive internal efficiency and ensure seamless service delivery for a risk management firm.

↠ Signature Operational & Onboarding Workflows:

Onboarding & Documentation Systems: Designed and implemented structured onboarding protocols to ensure all client data and documentation were captured accurately from day one.

SOP Development: Created and documented standard operating procedures (SOPs) to unify internal workflows and eliminate cross-departmental friction.

Project & Communication Coordination: Directed project timelines and client communication flows to ensure deliverables were met without delays.

Client Results & Impact:

Operational Risk Reduction: Significantly reduced internal errors and client friction by implementing standardized verification and reporting processes.

Workflow Standardization: Established a repeatable framework for client handovers, ensuring consistency across all account managers.

Efficiency Gains: Optimized internal project tracking, resulting in faster turnaround times for client risk assessments.

Improved Client Retention: Enhanced the initial client experience through structured follow-ups, leading to fewer early-stage issues and higher satisfaction.

experiences.title: Asset Verification Assistant | Asset Auditing, Cost-Saving Analysis, Data-Driven Project Execution
experiences.jobDescription:
Directed high-value asset audits and operational analysis for large-scale telecom infrastructure projects, ensuring data integrity and regulatory compliance.

↠ Signature Audit & Operational Workflows:

Asset Verification & Auditing: Led the systematic audit of infrastructure assets totaling $500M to ensure balance sheet accuracy and operational transparency.

Executive Reporting: Prepared and delivered data-backed operational reports for leadership to support high-stakes decision-making.

Compliance & Data Integrity: Managed verification protocols to align project data with internal standards and external regulatory requirements.

Client Results & Impact:

Efficiency Identification: Analyzed project workflows to identify structural inefficiencies, delivering recommendations that improved operational output.

Accuracy & Risk Mitigation: Reduced data discrepancies across infrastructure projects through the implementation of standardized verification checklists.

Stakeholder Alignment: Coordinated across technical and financial teams to ensure audit findings were accurately reflected in project timelines and budgets.

Scale & Precision: Successfully managed the data requirements for multi-million dollar asset portfolios without drop-offs in reporting quality.

headline: Helping Marketing Agencies save 15h/week by automating manual reporting | Data Modeling & Performance Dashboards
about:
I help companies make better decisions when the stakes are high.
Most of my work sits at the intersection of business, data, and execution.

I take messy, fragmented information and turn it into clear, defensible insights that leadership can actually use. Not just dashboards that look good, but analysis that answers real questions about cost, risk, performance, and opportunity.

I have worked on multi million dollar construction projects supporting owners and executives in subcontractor selection, bid analysis, and scope evaluation. I have also built analytics solutions for marketing, sales, and logistics teams, helping them understand what is driving revenue, costs, delays, and operational inefficiencies.

My approach is hands on and end to end. I handle data extraction, cleaning, modeling, and automation using Python, SQL, Power BI, and Excel. From there, I design executive ready dashboards and KPI frameworks that replace intuition with clarity and speed.

I am not interested in reporting for the sake of reporting. I focus on questions like which option is truly the most cost effective, where risk is being underestimated, what is driving performance, and how decisions today will impact results tomorrow.

If you are looking for someone who can bridge data, finance, and operations and turn complexity into clear business direction, we will work well together.

experiences.title: Bid Analysis Lead (Data & Cost Analytics)
experiences.jobDescription:
-Served as lead analyst for a $25M construction project, directly supporting project owners and company principals in selecting optimal subcontractors based on cost, scope coverage, and risk.

-Built the end-to-end bid analysis system: from raw subcontractor bids/scope sheets to executive-ready recommendations.

-Developed automated data pipelines to reduce manual work: Python (pandas) scraping + cleaning, repeatable transformations, and standardized outputs for Power BI refresh.

-Modeled relational datasets and created advanced DAX measures to quantify Scope Coverage %, Readiness %, exclusions, and cost-efficiency metrics.

-Designed executive-level Power BI dashboards enabling real-time comparisons by division/sub-division, scope compliance, and total cost impact.

-Implemented repeatable templates and refresh workflows so leadership can re-run bid leveling with new bids/scope updates in minutes, not days.

-Flagged scope gaps, inconsistencies, and pricing anomalies early, reducing downstream exposure to change orders and award mistakes.

-Acted as the data bridge between accounting, estimating, and leadership, shifting bid selection from intuition-based to analytics-driven decision-making.

experiences.title: Freelance Data Analyst | BI Developer | Supply Chain Analytics
experiences.jobDescription:
-Designed and delivered an end-to-end Supply Chain & Shipping Analytics Dashboard, consolidating thousands of shipment records into a single executive-ready BI solution.

-Built automated data transformation pipelines using Excel, SQL, and Power BI, eliminating manual reporting and enabling repeatable dashboard refreshes.

-Modeled logistics data to analyze shipment cost drivers including distance traveled, package weight, carrier performance, and delivery delays.

-Developed advanced DAX measures to calculate KPIs such as Average Cost per Mile, Delivery Time, Delay Rates, and Carrier Cost Efficiency.

-Enabled carrier-level performance benchmarking (FedEx, UPS, DHL, USPS, Amazon Logistics) based on cost, reliability, and delay exposure.

-Created trend, distribution, and correlation analyses to identify cost escalation patterns and operational inefficiencies.

-Designed executive-grade visual storytelling to support data-driven decisions in carrier selection, routing, and cost optimization.

-Delivered a scalable dashboard framework reusable for future logistics datasets and operational monitoring.

experiences.title: Freelance Data Analyst | BI Developer | Revenue & Marketing Analytics
experiences.jobDescription:
-Built an end-to-end Sales & Marketing Performance Analytics system, analyzing $330K+ in revenue across channels, geographies, and product categories.

-Designed automated ETL workflows using SQL, Power Query, and Excel to transform raw transactional and marketing data into analytics-ready datasets.

-Developed executive-level Power BI dashboards tracking revenue trends, order volume, return rates, AOV, and shipping cost impact.

-Performed marketing channel attribution analysis (Facebook Ads, Organic Search, Email, Referral, Instagram) to compare revenue contribution and order efficiency.

-Modeled customer and order behavior by city, country, and product category to identify top-performing markets and revenue concentration risks.

-Created advanced DAX measures to quantify KPIs such as Return Rate %, Average Order Value, Revenue per Channel, and Cost Drivers.

-Delivered data-backed insights to support marketing budget allocation, pricing strategy, and geographic expansion decisions.

-Replaced static reports with a scalable, refreshable BI framework designed for ongoing sales and marketing monitoring.

headline: SaaS Growth Partner + Fractional CMO | 0–$20M ARR | Fix pipeline leaks, lower costs, scale revenue
about:
I help SaaS and B2B product  startups (0–$20M ARR) fix GTM leaks, increase pipeline quality, and reduce acquisition costs.

Over the last 12 years, I’ve led gtm, demand gen, and revenue growth across the US, EU, UAE, and India.

What I help founders achieve:
- Higher 'demo → pipeline → revenue' conversion
- Lower cac through channel efficiency + funnel optimization
- Build inbound and outbound pipelines
- Align GTM systems across product, marketing, and sales

Recent outcomes:
Scaled MQLs from 50 → 200/month
Generated $6M in revenue on a $30K/month ad spend
Cut CAC by 35% through channel + funnel restructuring
2× landing page conversions with CRO + UX refinement

If your funnel feels leaky, CAC is rising, or you're not seeing predictable pipeline growth, I can help you diagnose the bottlenecks and build a system that compounds over time.

updates.postText:
This weekend, I had the opportunity to attend Launchpad Bangalore, organized by the E-Cell, BITS Pilani Hyderabad Campus. It was an inspiring day filled with incredible startup pitches, and panel discussions focusing on the future of sustainability, and AI innovation.

One of the standout moments for me was the sustainability panel, where Supriya Sharma made an important observation:
"VCs need to exercise a more patient cycle when it comes to sustainability and climate tech startups."

As someone who deeply cares about building a sustainable future, this struck me as a critical insight. Sustainability is the defining challenge of our time! Startups innovating in this space need more than funding; they need patient capital and long-term vision from investors. I believe the future of our planet depends on bold collaboration between founders, VCs, and policymakers.

A huge thank you to mridula goel and the organizing team for curating such a meaningful event. It’s always a pleasure to engage with BITS Pilani community.




#Sustainability #ClimateTech #Innovation #BITSian #FutureOfAI #Startups

🌟 Had an incredible time attending the marketing event hosted by eChai Ventures and GrowthSchool!
The session was packed with valuable insights and covered a wide range of marketing topics. It was a fantastic opportunity to learn and network with fellow professionals.
Looking forward to more such enriching sessions in the future!

#Marketing #Networking #Learning #eChaiVentures #GrowthSchool

This is the first time I'm seeing my name recognized as Founder of Grow Wasabi.

In the past, my name was next to titles like "Head of Marketing", "Fractional CMO", or "Marketing Strategist". But to see it linked directly to something I built from scratch is a huge deal!!

This is part of my origin story. 🤣 

🙏 Thank you Dr Aalok Pandit, Surya Narayanan
CMO Asia andWorld Leadership Congresss


#StartupGrowth #Leadership #Marketing

experiences.title: Head of Sales
experiences.jobDescription:
We help companies add net-new revenue by using AI + LinkedIn to respond faster, book more qualified meetings, and increase close rates—without adding headcount.
Recent examples:

- Enterprise services company booking 70+ meetings per week across 21 accounts
-$3M closed in 9 months with $28M added to pipeline
- 600% revenue growth in a single regional market
-SaaS company closed $4M in 12 months and raised seed funding

If your goal this year is to grow without burning out your sales team, or blowing out your payroll, it’s worth a conversation.

experiences.title: Founder
experiences.jobDescription:
www.gtmlegends.com

Small businesses and startups deserve to grow. But hiring full-time staff is expensive, risky, and slow. That’s why we created GTM Legends --To give you high-level GTM strategy and execution without full-time hires, hidden costs, or wasted time. We assemble a purpose-driven “A Team” of experts who plug into your business—from discovery to delivery—on your terms.

- No hiring overhead or onboarding risk
- A team that moves fast and delivers results
- Complete control of your brand, budget, and equity

updates.postText:
https://lnkd.in/gdNiU_ZJ
For all the reasons listed in the post below

This is huge. Saw a study recently that almost 80% of buyers end up choosing the company that responds first  🤯 

Speed is definitely a competitive advantage
https://lnkd.in/gDV2hAmM

CEOs face a new AI reality

McKinsey: Agentic AI is spreading fast — but only a few industries are actually scaling it.

According to McKinsey & Company, most companies now use AI, yet only a minority have deployed AI agents deeply enough to transform real workstreams.

Technology leads by a wide margin, with software engineering and IT showing the highest scaled use of agents. 

Healthcare stands out in knowledge management and IT, where agents already deliver operational leverage
Insurance is the surprise leader in agent-driven marketing and sales. 

Across industries, agentic AI adoption remains concentrated — usage ≠ transformation. 

The next AI gap won’t be between companies that use AI and those that don’t — it’ll be between those that deploy agents at scale and those stuck in pilot mode.
